alert.note: Alert for Northeastern Crook; Wyoming Black Hills (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 26 at 10:05PM MDT by NWS RapidCity
info.description: ...Heavy rain and strong winds will impact portions of southwestern Butte, northwestern Lawrence and east central Crook Counties through 1045 PM MDT... At 1004 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking an area of heavy rain and strong winds along a line extending from 7 miles north of Aladdin to Beulah to Crow Peak. Movement was northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Crow Peak and northern Spearfish Canyon around 1010 PM MDT. Spearfish around 1020 PM MDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Belle Fourche, Saint Onge, Fruitdale and Belle Fourche Reservoir. This includes... Interstate 90 in South Dakota between Mile Markers 1 and 13. Interstate 90 in Wyoming between Mile Markers 198 and 207. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
